channel.title: USPTO Other Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO Other events.

item.title: A fireside chat with USPTO patent examiners
item.description: Come join us for a laid back and informational fireside chat that will give you an inside look at being a patent examiner at the USPTO. You will get the opportunity to engage in insightful conversations and get answers to your questions directly from team members.

item.title: China IP: Quarterly legislation and case law update
Getting started with Patent Public Search
Fireside Chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims
item.description: Join the next Patent Trial and Appeal Board Boardside Chat webinar on Thursday, November 16, from noon to 1 p.m. ET, for a fireside chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims. Judge Holte will discuss the jurisdiction and types of cases handled by the Court of Federal Claims, procedures used in those cases, and best practices when appearing before the court.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VI: Learn how to protect your IP abroad
Learn about recent updates to internal decision circulation and review procedures at the PTAB
item.description: On October 6, 2023, the USPTO issued a Notice of Proposed Rulemaking (NPRM) on PTAB's pre-issuance internal decision circulation and review. The PTAB also issued a new Standing Operating Procedure on pre-issuance and post-issuance decision review, and updated and renumbered its SOP on handling remands from the Federal Circuit. Join the next PTAB Boardside Chat webinar on Thursday, November 16, from noon to 1 p.m. ET, for a discussion about the NPRM and the SOPs with PTAB's Vice Chief Judge Melissa Haapala.

item.title: Coming to New Orleans November 17: Women's entrepreneurship
Empowering Innovations: Celebrating Hispanic pioneers in education and invention-RESCHEDULED
item.description: This event has been rescheduled. Please refer to this listing for updates and information.

item.title: K-12 education office hours
Patent Public Advisory Committee public meeting
item.description: Attend the next public meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) to learn more about patent-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. You can watch the virtual public session via WebEx. The PPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part VII: How to file a patent application using Patent Center
Roundtable discussion: Tribes, intellectual property, and consumer protection
Intellectual Property Basics and Helpful Resources
The Path to a Patent, Part VIII: Common mistakes and post-filing support
A day in the life of a USPTO patent examiner
item.description: Do you want a challenging career? Would you like the opportunity to work from home nationwide with a flexible schedule? Do you want to be a part of a culture of inclusivity and camaraderie, and a community that leads America toward breakthroughs in innovation? Are you a U.S. citizen graduating this year with a focus in any of these fields? Biology Biomedical Engineering Chemistry Chemical Engineering Computer Engineering Computer Science Design Electrical Engineering Mechanical Engineering Physics If you answered yes to any of these questions, you may belong at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) as a patent examiner! We recruit the most promising at America's Innovation Agency, and we encourage you to take the step forward in your journey today by joining us on December 11 at noon ET for an informational webinar on becoming a patent examiner.
